isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - MASTER DIAGNOSTICS (MD 32) - EST HELP

svcproc.title: EST HELP
svcproc.para: Master Diagnostics has extensive documentation in the electronic help file. This section describes the organization and the layout of the Help file.
The Help file is arranged as follows: Company, Introduction, How to's, Programming, Menu and Toolbar, and Trouble Codes (DLC).
The Introduction includes software revisions. This topic documents changes to software releases. Click on Revision Information to display the software revision for this release.
The How to's topic describes usage, access, and examples. Double click How to's to display more help functions.

Trouble Codes (DLC) has service procedures and technical information about the International family of engines. Place the mouse pointer over a Diagnostic Trouble Code number or the circuit index to change from an arrow to a hand to indicate that these topics can be hot linked .

Example: Double click on the Diagnostic Trouble Code to bring up a detailed description of possible causes. This is normally displayed when double clicking the DTC in the Diagnostic Trouble Code window .

Click on a hot link in the circuit index to bring up a detailed description of the circuit involved with this Diagnostic Trouble Code and others. The circuit index is also organized under topics corresponding to their related Diagnostic Trouble Codes. Related circuit diagrams can be reviewed by clicking on the appropriate engine family hot link (V-8 or I-6 ) .

Example: Click on Diagnostic Trouble Code 131 for more information about that particular diagnostic code . Click on the I-6 hot link to open up an electrical diagram and voltage / resistance check for harnesses and connectors .
Click on Index. This displays all EST HELP topic indexes. Double click on an index item to display help information.

Click the Search tab. You can search help by using specific words or phrases or use advanced search to make conditional searches. Type in words or phrases in the search box and click on List Topics. Select the topic then click Display to view help information.
Check the Master Diagnostic software users manual for additional information.
